Next, you will extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. 4. **Extrude the 2D sketch**: - Extrude the sketch by 0.75 units in the positive Z-direction (towards the normal). - Set the opposite direction of the normal extrusion to 0.0 units. In this final step, you have created an intermediate CAD part based on the initial JSON configuration. Now move on to any additional parts and follow the same sequence of steps as you proceed. This will help you create the final CAD assembly as required.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construction of a Rectangular Prism Construct a rectangular prism with the following dimensions: * Length: 0.75 units * Width: 0.75 units * Height: 0.01 units Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin (0, 0, 0) with no rotation. 1. **Create the first face of the prism by sketching a rectangle on the XY plane as follows:** - Draw a line from (0, 0) to (0.5, 0). - Draw a line from (0.5, 0) to (0.5, 0.75). - Draw a line from (0.5, 0.75) to (0, 0.75). - Draw a line from (0, 0.75) to (0, 0) to close the loop. 2. **Extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D model with the following parameters:** - Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.01 units. - Extrude depth opposite the normal: 0 units. - Scaling factor: 0.75. Part 2: Construction of a Cylindrical Object with a Rectangular Hole Construct a cylindrical object with a rectangular hole at its center with the following dimensions: * Cylinder Height: 0.01 units * Cylinder Radius: 0.3125 units *(You can calculate it by multiplying the sketch_scale 0.375 by 0.833, which is the ratio related to the golden ratio for aesthetic purposes)* * Rectangular Hole Length: 0.375 units * Rectangular Hole Width: 0.375 units Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0.5, 0, 0.01) with no rotation. 1. **Create the cylindrical face of the object by sketching a circle on the XY plane as follows:** - Draw a circle with a center at (0.05, 0.05) and a radius of 0.05 units. 2. **Extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D model with the following parameters:** - Extrude depth towards the normal: 0 units. - Extrude depth opposite the normal: 0.01 units. - Scaling factor: 0.375. Part 3: Construction of a Cylindrical Object with a Tapered End Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered end with the following dimensions: * Cylinder Radius: 0.05 units * Tapered end length: 0.1 units * Tapering start height: 0.05 units Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0.3601, 0.125, 0.01) with no rotation. 1. **Create the cylindrical face of the object and the tapered end by sketching a circle on the XY plane as follows:** - Draw a circle with a center at (0.05, 0.05) and a radius of 0.05 units covering the full 360 degrees. 2. **Extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D model with the following parameters:** - Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.1 units. - Extrude depth opposite the normal: 0 units. - Scaling factor: 0.1 *(to create a tapered end)*. Finally, combine these parts by applying the correct boolean operations as specified in the original JSON (NewBodyFeatureOperation, JoinFeatureOperation, CutFeatureOperation). The resulting assembly will be a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center.</description>
